text: music. This was the village doctor who was an old school friend at Clifton. He could sustain the tenor part quite well and lead the others. As for basses and altos the conductor had to teach by singing the parts with them. It was very amusing, and by the end of a few months an enthusiastic choir of men and women could render simple part-singing tolerably well.
